title: What is the difference between music and song? - Quora

response.answer_text: Music is collection of all kinds of musical pieces or work. Song is also a part of music. We can say music is a set of Rhythms played together. It has many different sub parts like song, Rap, March, Symphony and many others. Music is a art and is very versatile. Song is a famous kind of music and is played and heard everywhere. Singers are famous as because there music is listened. Songs is either played with rhythms or musical instruments. Cool and Smooth Music provides positive effects to body. Whenever you depressed listen to col jazz music. Gustavo Woltmann

Yes. Music is a set of sounds set to rhythm. A song is one example of a form of those sets of sounds. It could be a song, a rap, a jig, a march, a symphony, a scat, etc. All of these things are forms of music. The people who play rhythms on buckets and cans outside many concerts are performing music, but they’re not necessarily playing a song. The orchestra performing a symphony is playing music, but not a song. The singer/guitarist in the local coffee house is playing a song, which is also music. But it’s a specific form of music.
